intro: Stenocarpus gracilis, commonly known as the slender tallowwood, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or cream-colored flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its woody structure and ornamental value make it a popular choice for horticultural use. Stenocarpus gracilis typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
